bring up                                 When a new computer design is first assembled (especially, with a new CPU chip), it needs help from humans. They must "bring" the computer "up" ("up" means "running normally")
bring-up                                 the period between the first time that all the hardware is connected and turned on, and the time that this collection of hardware seems to work and run the OS, at least for a few minutes. After "bring-up", the system is possibly still "full of bugs"
